snippet: The agency is secretly collecting bulk records of international money transfers, under the same law that the National Security Agency uses for its phone record database, according to  government officials.
abstract: Central Intelligence Agency is secretly collecting bulk records of international money transfers handled by companies like Western Union--including transactions into and out of the United States--under the same law that the National Security Agency uses for its huge database of Americans’ phone records; revelation offers further evidence that extent of government data collection programs is not fully known.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and MARK MAZZETTI

lead_paragraph: The agency is secretly collecting bulk records of international money transfers, under the same law that the National Security Agency uses for its phone record database, according to  government officials.

headline.main: C.I.A. Collects Global Data on Transfers of Money
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Collects Global Data On Transfers Of Money
